decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By efficiently utilizing low cost creatures like Fanatical Firebrand and Viashino Pyromancer, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock, the deck aims to keep the pressure on the opponent from the very start. Rekindling Phoenix provides a resilient threat that is difficult to deal with, while Experimental Frenzy allows for card advantage and consistency in drawing into more threats and burn spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, evasive creatures while protecting them with countermagic and protection spells. The goal is to establish early board presence with cards like Mist-Cloaked Herald and Merfolk Trickster, then maintain card advantage with Curious Obsession. By using cards like Siren Stormtamer and Dive Down to protect key creatures, the deck aims to deal damage consistently and efficiently to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on a strong early game presence with efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Merfolk Branchwalker, supported by removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Ravenous Chupacabra. The deck also includes cards like Seekers' Squire and Jadelight Ranger to help with card advantage and graveyard recursion with cards like Find / Finality. Carnage Tyrant serves as a powerful finisher, backed up by planeswalkers like Vraska, Golgari Queen and Vivien Reid for additional card advantage and removal options. This deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with a mix of aggression and resilience.

Utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and removal spells, the Golgari Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and disruption. Cards like Jadelight Ranger and Wildgrowth Walker help generate card advantage and life gain, while Vraska, Golgari Queen and Vraska, Relic Seeker provide additional removal and threats. The deck's ability to both control the board and apply pressure allows it to adapt to various matchups and secure victory through a combination of efficient creature attacks and spellcasting.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to quickly fill the graveyard with instants and sorceries, enabling the recursion of Arclight Phoenix. This strategy is supported by creatures like Crackling Drake and Enigma Drake to apply pressure on the opponent. Goblin Electromancer reduces the cost of spells, while Maximize Velocity provides additional burst damage. Chart a Course and Radical Idea help with card draw, while removal spells like Shock and Beacon Bolt deal with threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal and card draw in order to stabilize the board and outvalue the opponent. By using cards like Sinister Sabotage and Syncopate to counter threats, Deafening Clarion to wipe the board, and Chemister's Insight for card advantage, the deck aims to survive until the late game where powerful threats like Niv-Mizzet, Parun and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria can take over the game. It also includes a backup win condition in the form of Crackling Drake and Ral, Izzet Viceroy.

The main strategy of this Jeskai Control deck is to maintain board control and disrupt opponent's plans using counterspells and removal spells. The deck also focuses on card advantage through draw spells like Chemister's Insight and Opt, as well as life gain from cards like Revitalize. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Ral, Izzet Viceroy provide powerful planeswalker threats that can help close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can establish a dominant position and win through a combination of card advantage and powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using a combination of powerful creatures and token generation. By deploying efficient threats early in the game and leveraging cards like History of Benalia and March of the Multitudes to create a wide board presence, the deck aims to quickly build up a strong board state and pressure the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Additional cards like Flower/Flourish and Pride of Conquerors provide buffs and additional ways to pump up the team for a decisive attack.

This deck aims to put pressure on the opponent quickly with efficient creatures and ramping into strong threats like Carnage Tyrant. The focus is on building a board presence early with mana dorks and explore creatures like Jadelight Ranger. The deck also includes removal spells to deal with threats and planeswalkers to generate card advantage and provide additional threats. The deck has a solid mana base to consistently cast its spells and aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creature threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and removal spells to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats. By utilizing cards like Jadelight Ranger and Llanowar Elves to ramp up mana production, the deck can deploy powerful threats like Carnage Tyrant and Vraska, Golgari Queen to quickly close out games. The inclusion of cards like Find / Finality and Golgari Findbroker allow the deck to recover resources from the graveyard and maintain a steady stream of threats and answers. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure and outvalue opponents in the mid to late game.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence with efficient creatures like Jadelight Ranger and Llanowar Elves, while also disrupting opponents with removal spells like Ravenous Chupacabra and Vraska's Contempt. Vivien Reid and Vraska provide card advantage and additional threats, while Find / Finality offers flexibility in dealing with different situations. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of threats, backed up by strong removal and resilient creatures like Carnage Tyrant. The key strategy is to apply early pressure and maintain control of the board throughout the game.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm opponents with a constant stream of aggressive creatures while also disrupting their strategy with removal spells and disruptive cards. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Jadelight Ranger and Carnage Tyrant to apply pressure, while also including removal spells like Ravenous Chupacabra and Vraska's Contempt to deal with threats from the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Wildgrowth Walker and Midnight Reaper to maintain card advantage and gain life. Ultimately, the goal is to establish a strong board presence and control the game until victory is achieved.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently play out aggressive creatures like Arclight Phoenix and Crackling Drake, while also utilizing cheap spells like Shock and Lava Coil to control the board and clear a path for attacks. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Electromancer and Opt help to increase card advantage and streamline the deck's strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, spell-heavy game plan that puts pressure on their life total and forces them to react to the threats on the board.

The deck focuses on generating tempo and aggression through a combination of powerful creatures like Arclight Phoenix and Crackling Drake along with spells that fuel their abilities such as Opt, Radical Idea, and Shock. By utilizing cards like Goblin Electromancer and Maximize Velocity, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with a flurry of spells and attacks. The deck's strategy revolves around quickly filling up the graveyard to enable the recursive nature of Arclight Phoenix while also presenting threats like Enigma Drake to close out games.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Arclight Phoenix and Crackling Drake, supported by spells that can be cast for a low cost thanks to Goblin Electromancer. The deck includes plenty of card draw and removal to keep up the pressure and maintain board control. By efficiently using instants and sorceries, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and consistently to win the game before the opponent can stabilize. The synergy between spells, creatures, and mana acceleration is crucial for its success.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while utilizing powerful card advantage and efficient removal spells. With a focus on tempo and resource management, this Jeskai Control deck aims to outlast the opponent through card draw effects like Chemister's Insight and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, while clearing the board with cards like Deafening Clarion and Cleansing Nova. The deck also includes versatile counterspells like Ionize and Syncopate to protect key threats and disrupt the opponent's plays.
